00286 // explicit declaration of LevelSetMethodPatchStrategy and 
00287 // LevelSetMethodVelocityFieldStrategy to 
00288 // avoid circular dependencies in the header files.
00289 template<int DIM> class LevelSetMethodPatchStrategy;
00290 template<int DIM> class LevelSetMethodVelocityFieldStrategy;

01367   /*
01368    * The object name is used for error/warning reporting and also as a 
01369    * string label for restart database entries. 
01370    */
01371   string d_object_name;
01372 
01373 
01374   /* 
01375    * User-defined parameters 
01376    */
01377 
01378   // general level set method parameters 
01379   int d_num_level_set_fcn_components;   // number of components for level
01380                                         //   set functions
01381   int d_codimension;                    // codimension of problem
01382   LSMLIB_REAL d_start_time;                  // start time for calculation
01383   LSMLIB_REAL d_end_time;                    // end time for calculation
01384   LSMLIB_REAL d_cfl_number;                  // CFL number
01385   SPATIAL_DERIVATIVE_TYPE               // type of spatial derivative: 
01386        d_spatial_derivative_type;       //   default = WENO 
01387   int d_spatial_derivative_order;       // order of spatial derivative
01388   int d_tvd_runge_kutta_order;          // order of TVD Runge-Kutta time 
01389                                         //   integration
01390   int d_reinitialization_interval;      // interval between reinitialization
01391   LSMLIB_REAL d_reinitialization_stop_tol;   // stopping criterion for termination
01392                                         //   of evolution of reinitialization 
01393                                         //   equation.  Reinitialization 
01394                                         //   stops when the max norm of the 
01395                                         //   change in the level set function 
01396                                         //   drops below the specified 
01397                                         //   tolerance.
01398   LSMLIB_REAL d_reinitialization_stop_dist;  // stopping criterion for termination
01399                                         //   of evolution of reinitialization 
01400                                         //   equation.  Reinitialization 
01401                                         //   approximately propogates 
01402                                         //   information outward from the 
01403                                         //   zero level set by the specified
01404                                         //   distance
01405   int d_reinitialization_max_iters;     // maximum number of time steps 
01406                                         //   for reinitialization iteration
01407   int d_orthogonalization_interval;     // interval between orthogonalizing
01408                                         //   phi and psi for codim-two problems
01409   LSMLIB_REAL d_orthogonalization_stop_tol;  // stopping criterion for termination
01410                                         //   of evolution of orthogonalization 
01411                                         //   equation.  Orthogonalization
01412                                         //   stops when the max norm of the 
01413                                         //   change in the level set function 
01414                                         //   drops below the specified 
01415                                         //   tolerance.
01416   LSMLIB_REAL d_orthogonalization_stop_dist; // stopping criterion for termination
01417                                         //   of evolution of orthogonalization 
01418                                         //   equation.  Orthogonalization 
01419                                         //   approximately propogates 
01420                                         //   information outward from the 
01421                                         //   zero level set by the specified
01422                                         //   distance
01423   int d_orthogonalization_max_iters;    // maximum number of time steps 
01424                                         //   for orthogonalization iteration
01425 
01426   // AMR parameters
01427   bool d_use_AMR;                       // true if AMR should be used
01428   int d_regrid_interval;                // regridding interval
01429   int d_tag_buffer_width;               // number of buffer cells to use around
01430                                         //   cells tagged for refinement
01431   LSMLIB_REAL d_refinement_cutoff_value;     // cutoff value for distance function
01432 
01433   // Miscellaneous parameters
01434   bool d_verbose_mode;                  // true if status information should
01435                                         //   be output
01436 
01437   /*
01438    * User-defined level set method strategy objects
01439    */
01440 
01441   // Pointer to the LevelSetMethodPatchStrategy.  This object
01442   // is used to initialize and set boundary conditions for the 
01443   // level set functions. 
01444   LevelSetMethodPatchStrategy<DIM>*  d_lsm_patch_strategy;
01445 
01446   // Pointer to LevelSetMethodVelocityFieldStrategy.  This object
01447   // is used to set the velocity field for the time advance of the
01448   // level set functions.  It is also used to provide some physics-based
01449   // restrictions on the maximum allowable dt to use for advancing
01450   // the level set functions in time.
01451   LevelSetMethodVelocityFieldStrategy<DIM>*  d_lsm_velocity_field_strategy;
01452 
01453 
01454   /*
01455    * Grid management objects
01456    */
01457 
01458   // Pointer to the patch hierarchy object
01459   Pointer< PatchHierarchy<DIM> > d_patch_hierarchy;
01460 
01461   // Pointer to the grid geometry.  The CartesianGridGeometry object
01462   // is used to set up initial data, set physical boundary conditions, 
01463   // and register plot variables.
01464   Pointer< CartesianGridGeometry<DIM> > d_grid_geometry;
01465 
01466   // Pointer to reinitialization algorithms which manage the 
01467   // reinitialization of level set functions to distance functions
01468   Pointer< ReinitializationAlgorithm<DIM> > d_phi_reinitialization_alg;
01469   Pointer< ReinitializationAlgorithm<DIM> > d_psi_reinitialization_alg;
01470 
01471   // Pointer to orthogonalization algorithm which manages the 
01472   // orthogonalization of gradients of phi and psi for 
01473   // codimension-two problems
01474   Pointer< OrthogonalizationAlgorithm<DIM> > d_orthogonalization_alg;
01475 
01476   
01477   /*
01478    * PatchData handles for data required by level set method
01479    */
01480 
01481   // PatchData handles for level set functions
01482   // NOTE:  the 0-th component of both of these vectors
01483   //        contains the PatchData handle for the current
01484   //        solution of the level set function.  The
01485   //        remainder are PatchData handles for scratch
01486   //        space associated with the TVD Runge-Kutta
01487   //        time integration.
01488   vector<int> d_phi_handles;
01489   vector<int> d_psi_handles;
01490 
01491   // forward and backward spatial derivatives
01492   int d_grad_phi_plus_handle;
01493   int d_grad_psi_plus_handle;
01494   int d_grad_phi_minus_handle;
01495   int d_grad_psi_minus_handle;
01496 
01497   // upwind spatial derivatives
01498   int d_grad_phi_upwind_handle;
01499   int d_grad_psi_upwind_handle;
01500 
01501   // right-hand side of evolution equations 
01502   // (i.e. level set equation, reinitialization 
01503   //  equation, and orthogonalization equation)
01504   int d_rhs_phi_handle;
01505   int d_rhs_psi_handle;
01506 
01507   // auxilliary variables
01508   int d_control_volume_handle;
01509 
01510   // level set ghostcell width
01511   IntVector<DIM> d_level_set_ghostcell_width;
01512 
01513   /*
01514    * Component selectors to organize variables into logical groups
01515    */
01516   ComponentSelector d_solution_variables;
01517   ComponentSelector d_time_advance_scratch_variables;
01518   ComponentSelector d_compute_stable_dt_scratch_variables;
01519   ComponentSelector d_reinitialization_scratch_variables;
01520   ComponentSelector d_orthogonalization_scratch_variables;
01521   ComponentSelector d_persistent_variables;
01522 
01523 
01524   /* internal state  variables */
01525 
01526   // flags
01527   bool d_use_reinitialization;
01528   bool d_use_reinitialization_stop_tol;
01529   bool d_use_reinitialization_stop_dist;
01530   bool d_use_reinitialization_max_iters;
01531   bool d_use_orthogonalization;
01532   bool d_use_orthogonalization_stop_tol;
01533   bool d_use_orthogonalization_stop_dist;
01534   bool d_use_orthogonalization_max_iters;
01535 
01536   // counter variables
01537   LSMLIB_REAL d_current_time;
01538   int d_num_integration_steps_taken;
01539   int d_reinitialization_count;
01540   int d_orthogonalization_count;
01541   LEVEL_SET_FCN_TYPE d_orthogonalization_evolved_field;
01542   int d_regrid_count;
01543 
01544   /*
01545    * Boundary condition objects
01546    */
01547   Pointer< BoundaryConditionModule<DIM> > d_bc_module;
01548   Array< IntVector<DIM> > d_lower_bc_phi;
01549   Array< IntVector<DIM> > d_upper_bc_phi;
01550   Array< IntVector<DIM> > d_lower_bc_psi;
01551   Array< IntVector<DIM> > d_upper_bc_psi;
01552 
01553   /*
01554    * Communication objects.
01555    */
01556 
01557   // for filling a new level
01558   Pointer< RefineAlgorithm<DIM> > d_fill_new_level;
01559 
01560   // for filling boundary data used during the calculation of 
01561   // a stable dt for motion under normal velocity
01562   Pointer< RefineAlgorithm<DIM> > d_fill_bdry_compute_stable_dt;
01563   Array< Pointer< RefineSchedule<DIM> > >
01564     d_fill_bdry_sched_compute_stable_dt;
01565

01568   Array< Array< Pointer< RefineSchedule<DIM> > > >
